page.title: 06A WELSH MOUNTAIN FARM.
page.content: In May we visited Gwrhyd Uchaf farm. We travelled from school by car and reached the farm by travelling down a rough dirt track. The farm is owned by Mr. and Mrs. Davies and their three children. Mr. Davies has a full-time job so Mrs. Davies is the farmer. They have lived there for thirty years but the farmhouse is ninety years old. The farm is average in size. There are 165 acres, about 30 fields in all. Most of the land is rough hillside so the main stock is Welsh Mountain sheep. At the time of our visit they had 600 ewes, 15 rams and 800 lambs. It was the tail end of the lambing season but there were still twenty ewes waiting to give birth. All the ewes are scanned to see how many lambs they are going to have. Many have twins,a few have triplets.
